title: YTMND: <acronym title="What Is Love">WIL</acronym>
body: <p>Remember <a href="http://travis.servebeer.com/blog.net/archive/2002/10/10/yourethemannowdog.aspx">You're the man now dog</a>? Remember the SNL skit <em>A Night at the Roxbury</em>? and the site that let you make your own <a href="http://travis.servebeer.com/blog.net/archive/2004/05/13/ytmnd.aspx">YTMND</a>? They are kinda <a href="http://ckjcwf.ytmnd.com/">funny combined</a>. Then there's: <a href="http://whatisnes.ytmnd.com/">What is NES Love</a>. Then: <a href="http://whatistiger.ytmnd.com/">What is Tiger</a>. Not geeky enough? How about: <a href="http://whatistng.ytmnd.com/">What is TNG, A Night at the Roddenberry</a>? Still not enough? The grand finale: <a href="http://anightatthehothberry.ytmnd.com/">Picard IS the Empire, A Night at the Hothberry</a>.</p><p>EDIT: I've been going through all the other YTMND's, this one brought tears to my eyes: <a href="http://threesecondsmores.ytmnd.com/">3 second pop tarts</a>.</p>
